availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Newell Warren (Jefferson County, Kentucky, civil engineer and banker)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, civil engineer and banker. Massachusetts native. Son of Jonas Warren and Dolly Warren. Married to Myra Aldridge Warren in Garrard County, Kentucky, on May 30, 1843. Father of Frank Warren, Mary Warren, Emily Warren, Charles Warren, Anna Warren, Myra Warren, and William Warren. Graduated from Harvard University in Cambridge, Massachusetts, in 1834. Civil engineer in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1850. Banker in Jefferson County in 1860. Employed Ellen McCormick as a domestic servant in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860. Partner with J.P. Curtis and Henry P. Rutter in the banking firm Curtis & Warren in Louisville in 1860 and in 1861. Founder of the firm C.N. Warren & Company Bankers in Louisville from 1861 to 1865. President of the Louisville City National Bank in Louisville in 1865.
